revised_title: Ernest James William Barrington: A Pioneering Zoologist and Educator
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of Ernest James William Barrington, a prominent zoologist and educator who made significant contributions to the fields of comparative endocrinology and zoology. He worked at the University of Nottingham and held various positions in the Zoological Society of London and the Institute of Biology. Barrington was also elected to the Royal Society and served on its council and as a vice-president. His life and work are celebrated for their impact on the development of zoology and the education of future biologists.
